column4: do i have to save session everytime i log off of xfce on ubuntu?
well i installed conky and gdesklets, and everytime i log in session they aren't running, whats the save session for?
like I have xmms, streamtuner and gaim running, I log out and check the save session button, and they will be there when I boot up again
I unchecked the save session button to leave it so it brings up just xmms, streamtuner and gaim, but leaving it checked will start you from where you left off the previos time
when u log in do u choose start xfce or last?
I just log in and and it automaticaly starts xfce... unless I tell it to start KDE or fluxbox
I like xfce so I lust use it all the time
i want to use xfce all the time so how do i prevent the other options or how do i autochoose xfce to boot up?
when you lon in, it will pop up a box that tells you that xfce is not your defult session... click on the "make defult" button... then it should go to xfce every time
i don't see that box. i have a box at the top it says "last" then something else and the bottom it says "xfce" so i choose xfce.
I cant explain it any further
what's the diff between last session and xfce?
